mods.abstract: Colossi of Memnon (New Kingdom - Dynasty XVIII) in the Theban Plain, West Thebes. Indistinguishable sandstone statues of Amenhotep III with smaller figures of his wife, Tiy, and mother, Mutemwiya, base of throne, Nile God Hapy inscised onto sides (middle ground); Egyptian men (foreground), mountain range (background); "Colossi of Memnon" in pencil on the back of print.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
